intro: Mesosphaerum marrubiastrum, commonly known as the roughleaf marrubia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, rough-textured leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. Its small yellow flowers bloom in clusters, and the plant is known for its hardy, drought-resistant nature. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and habitat for various insects and small animals.
